p:
As aforementioned, glycosidases play a pivotal role in controlling not only the metabolic pathways where carbohydrates are present but also many other significant biochemical events, like cell-to-cell communication or recognition processes. Herein, a panel of five commercially-available glycosidases have been tested, as models of carbohydrate-mediated diseases: α-glucosidase (from Saccharomyces cerevisiae), β-glucosidase (from almonds), α-galactosidase (from green coffee beans) and β-galactosidase (from A. oryzae and from E. coli). Deficiencies in such enzymes are associated with diabetes, Gaucher’s disease, Fabry’s disease, and gangliosidosis, respectively
